Posts.Title: I thought I was ok RoseRed4 lara1975

Posts.Content: RoseRed4 wrote: Hello all, my name is Rose. I turned 50 in April and have stage 2 breast cancer. DCIS and idc. Got my malignant diagnosis on May 11th. Had a Lumpectomy and 2 lymph nodes removed on 5-30-18. Invasive tumor was 1.5 cm. Both nodes were positive for cancer, so next step is a cat scan to make sure it hasn't spread anywhere else and then begin chemo. Just writing all this down gives me the willies, but this is my new reality. Before my 2nd mammogram in April, I had no idea anything was even wrong. I'd been told after my 1st mammogram, something 'suspicious' had been found. Biopsy was done on May 7. I hope my cat scan will be ok Dx 5/11/2018, DCIS/IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 2/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 5/29/2018 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 7/15/2018 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I thought I was ok RoseRed4 lara1975

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2018 08:56AM - edited Jun 20, 2018 08:57AM by RoseRed4 Thank you so much! Still playing the waiting game here. Waiting to hear from my doctor's office about when I can get a cat scan. Called Monday and was told they'll let me know as soon as my insurance approves it..grr Patience has never been one of my virtues. Lol The treadmill has been my faithful friend in helping to keep me sane through all this. I always feel better after my 3 miles on it,almost every day. Physically I'm feeling great, just ready to get to the next step and get that dang scan over with. Already got a few pretty beanie caps for when I lose my hair. Took 2 days to get them out of my mailbox, but I got er done eventually :-) Rose

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2018 10:19AM RoseRed4 wrote: Hello, I had a Lumpectomy and 2 lymph nodes removed also on May 30th and found out last week the nodes were positive for cancer too, so now it's a cat scan next for me and then chemo. Yeah, it's terrifying thats for sure. My doctor had kinda made me feel confident it hadn't spread to the lymph nodes and I'd probably only have to do radiation, but it is what it is. This waiting is the hardest part..not knowing what is going on inside of me. I just wanted to say thanks for posting here and good luck to you as well! Reading this thread has helped me too. Thank you al
